captions.text:
- What? Geez, what is it?
- There's a, there's a...
- Yeah, that's a really big fuckin spider.

Weird Things Couples Do
When There's a Spider
Oh, wow, that's a big one.
- What do you wanna do now?
- I dunno. It just feels right, ya know?

- Taking a picture of
it, I wanna look it up.

- Oh, it's not poisonous.
- How do you know?!
- Because we don't live in the Congo.
Just get rid of it, okay?
- Why do I have to get rid of it?
- Whoa, whoa, whoa, what are you doing?
- That thing could eat a baby.

Here, ya know what? I
will take care of it.
Okay, there's two of them now.
We'll throw it in the bag.

title: Weird Things Couples Do When There's a Spider

comments.text:
My mom sprays the crap out of spiders or bugs with a can of Lysol. It 
works, lesson is keep a few cans of Lysol in your house. ﻿
comments.author: Elise Jones

comments.text: This is too hilarious ﻿
comments.author: Fatma Ahmed

comments.text:
I will not hesitate to kill a spider. Or rather, I will not hesitate to 
order my sister to kill a spider, and when bossing her around doesn't work, 
I will whine pathetically and annoyingly until she relents and deals with 
the offending spider appropriately (i.e. kill it).  
I just hate bugs with a passion, especially spiders.﻿

arachnaphobic.

comments.author: fiyero51

comments.text:
When I was little, it was about 9:00 pm, and there was this *huge* spider 
in my room. Freaked out a little, but reasoned to myself that it at least 
wasn't moving anywhere, and then spent the next ten minutes mentally 
preparing myself. Grabbed my favorite stuffed animal, a rolled up 
newspaper, and slowly snook up to attack it.


Took me a while to figure out it was just a bouncy ball on my floor.﻿

comments.text:
why do people kill spiders?

as long as they don't sit above my bed, I just ignore them. If they are

outside and unharmed and I am inside and unharmed.﻿

There was a spider on my wall when I was sleeping. I freaked out a bit, but 
then thought it was fine and I didn't need to worry. Went back to sleep and 
woke up to a specific creature crawling on me.
I quickly swatted it away and it was gone. Disappeared. 
And that terrified me even more making me regret swatting it away.﻿

comments.author: LOL

comments.text:
This is every guy's worse nightmare because like every time someone sees a 
spider, the guy HAS to kill it, I'm a boy (13 years) and is it bad that i'm 
SO SCARED of spiders and bugs and gross things like that. Sometimes i just 
wish i had some type of spider communicator to tell the spider to leave. 
xD. Like i think maybe 2 or 3 weeks ago, it was 1 am and i saw a little 
spider in the corner of my ceiling, and i just stood there staring at it. 
It then finally started to move and it was coming closer to me. I was gonna 
kill it until i started getting closer to it and i think it's gonna crawl 
on me or just jump on me. Plus i hate hearing the sound of killing a 
spider. The sound of it sounds like smashing potato chips just with more 
crackles. So it ended up crawling into the vent and i slept. The next day 
it came back and i just told my dad to kill it :P. Sooooooooo yea i feel 
bad that i'm a boy and i HATE spiders. I hope i'm not the only one. If 
you've read this so far THANK YOU! Please reply if so. ﻿

I've always been afraid of bugs, and i'm not ashamed to say that as long as 
it's got some gross insect/arachnid legs that move or twitch and it's 
gross/creepy looking and somewhere within 300 feet i will follow my typical 
procedures for bugs which consists of:
1. seizing/jumping out of my skin
2. screaming/yelping
3. throw large objects at it in hopes of smushing it
4. if 3 doesn't work, wake someone up or get someone to kill it before it 
makes babies﻿
